page.title: 03 MIDDLETON PARK GROUNDS
page.content: The front of the house faces Home Wood,which was planted in the time of King John(1201)and recently repurchased by the Estate.A deer herd roams here.A very impressive Cedar tree, purported to be the best in the country faces the front door.The only remaining feature of the old house is the carved lion on the corner and the original astrolabe which was recovered from a garden.A copy of this can be seen in Clock Court.Today the house has been sublet into longterm leases and occupied mainly by retired residents. The south facing lawn is occupied by a croquet lawn and gardens. This view will be interupted by the silos of the chicken factory if built.
